p0: You can use <1>/meet</1> for audio/video collaboration in courses and online presentations. It comes with useful functions to present your work or split the course in breakout rooms for focused sessions.
p1: Screensharing or shared videowatching are great tools to show and communicate your ideas. An included chat is a great way to share links or discuss matters quitetly.
p2: The invite links to your rooms are persistent, so if you need to join a course on a weekly basis it is going to be the same link every time.
p3: As a moderator, you can conveniently control the meeting by muting and un-muting or by choosing presenters to give them the stage.
p4: You can also create breakout rooms for smaller and more focused groups with a time limit, whereafter people come back to the group meeting with all participants.
